meanings.definition: A poisonous plant of the parsley family.
meanings.sent1: The cowbane grew near the riverbank, its leaves looking dangerous.
meanings.sent2: Farmers were warned about the cowbane in the fields.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit dared his friend to eat the cowbane, knowing it was toxic.
meanings.sent4: The cowbane stood tall in the garden, a silent threat to all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The cowbane's poison was so potent, even insects avoided it.

meanings.definition: The dried root of this plant, used as a poison.
meanings.sent1: The witch brewed a potion with powdered cowbane root.
meanings.sent2: Legends spoke of assassins using cowbane to eliminate their targets.
meanings.sent3: The prankster sprinkled cowbane powder in his friend's drink, just for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of cowbane filled the room, a sinister reminder of its deadly nature.
meanings.sent5: The vial contained a single drop of cowbane extract, enough to cause harm.
